New Records: The Cavs set a new franchise record with their 10th straight win by double digits
Key Match Events: Darius Garland and LaMelo Ball engaged in a spirited duel that set the tone for the game
The Cavs held just a six-point lead after the first quarter, but went on a run in the second quarter to give them a 24-point lead at one point
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavs were coming off a four-game road trip where they swept their Western Conference opponents
The Hornets were on a nine-game losing skid entering the contest
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavs' coach Kenny Atkinson was pleased with the team's focus and energy
Darius Garland stated that he wants to be an All-Star and plans on being in San Francisco
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first fan returns for All-Star voting
The Cavs' offense flowed seamlessly, with crisp ball movement and unselfishness resulting in assists on 29 of their 44 made baskets
Others: The Cavs' Evan Mobley contributed 17 points, rounding out a cohesive offensive effort
The Cavs' next game will be against the Western Conference-leading Oklahoma City Thunder
